(3) a. Makású mbidzí zi-na-í-gúl-íl-á awa óbúntha
`(As for) hoes, the zebras bought (for) the aged lions these blunt ones.'

(8) a. Zisakasa mkángó wópúsa u-na-máng-á zi-sanu z-ókha
Lit. `Grass huts, the silly lion built only five.'

Lit. `Five zebras, the lion is chasing them in a cruel manner (cruelly).'
Lit. `Five zebras, the lion is chasing them in a cruel manner (cruelly).'
Mbidzí zi-sanu mkángó u-ku-zí-thámángits-á mwá nkhanza
Five zebras, the lion is chasing them in a cruel manner (cruelly).
`The lion which hunts goats bothers the hunters who fell trees.'
`The lion which hunts goats bothers the hunters who fell trees.'
Mkángo u-méné ú-ma-sáká mbûzi ú-ma-wa-saútsa alenje a-méné á-ma-gwetsá mitêngo
The lion which hunts goats bothers the hunters who fell trees.
The lion which is hunting goats...
The lion that is hunting goats...
`The hunters the lion bother them, who fell trees, that hunts goats.'
`The hunters the lion bother them, who fell trees, that hunts goats.'
Alenje mkángó ú-ma-wa-saútsa a-méné á-ma-gwetsá miténgo u-méné ú-ma-saká mbúzi
The hunters the lion bother them, who fell trees, that hunts goats.
(14) Mkángo uméné úma zi saka mbûzi ú-ma-wa-saútsa alenje améné
`The lion which hunts the goats bothers the hunters that fell the trees.'
(14) Mkángo uméné úma zi saka mbûzi ú-ma-wa-saútsa alenje améné
`The lion which hunts the goats bothers the hunters that fell the trees.'
Mkángo uméné úma zi saka mbûzi ú-ma-wa-saútsa alenje améné amaigwetsa miténgo.
The lion which hunts the goats bothers the hunters that fell the trees.
(15) a. *Mkángo mbûzi alenje miténgo úmawasautsa umêné umazisaka
Lit. `The lion, the goats, the hunters, the trees, it bothers them
which hunts them (goats) who fell them (trees).'
(15) a. *Mkángo mbûzi alenje miténgo úmawasautsa umêné umazisaka
Lit. `The lion, the goats, the hunters, the trees, it bothers them
which hunts them (goats) who fell them (trees).'
Mkángo mbûzi alenje miténgo úmawasautsa umêné umazisaka améné ámaigwetsa.
The lion, the goats, the hunters, the trees, it bothers them which hunts them (goats) who fell them (trees).
b. *Mbûzi mkángo uméné úmazisaka miténgo alenje améné
Lit. `The goats the lion that hunts them (goats) the trees the hunters
who fell them (the trees) it (the lion) bothers them (hunters).'
b. *Mbûzi mkángo uméné úmazisaka miténgo alenje améné
Lit. `The goats the lion that hunts them (goats) the trees the hunters
who fell them (the trees) it (the lion) bothers them (hunters).'
Mbûzi mkángo uméné úmazisaka miténgo alenje améné amaigwetsa úmawasautsa.
The goats the lion that hunts them (goats) the trees the hunters who fell them (the trees) it (the lion) bothers them (hunters).

`The mad baboons are smashing the calabash of the hunters' spy.'
`The mad baboons are smashing the calabash of the hunters' spy.'
anyaní á mísala a-ku-chí-phwány-a chipanda chá kazitápé wá alenje
The mad baboons are smashing the calabash of the hunters' spy.

`The mad baboons are smashing the calabash of the beauty-queen of the
